answers.author: Timothy McLean
answers.text:
Steven,
In my previous occupation with the City of Troy, MI, they had just adopted a new zoning ordinance, which was a hybrid of traditional zoning and form based codes. The entire ordinance is available online at www.troymi.gov In Troy, the new form based codes were intended to streamline the process of site plan approval and lessen the agendas of both the planning commission and the zoning board of appeals. 
Also in Jonesville, I am currently overseeing a transition from traditional zoning to form based codes in our downtown area. We're receiving proposals from various firms and are in the very preliminary stages.

answers.text:
We have written many form-based zoning codes.  One of which you should definitely check out for its value capture during the recession: 
City of Roanoke, TX at www.gatewayplanning.com and also at the city website.  The most recent New Urban News also has an article about this project, attached.
You can also look on our website under Form-Based Codes, for other codes we've done.
